00030 #include "../common/common.h"
00031 #include "../common/poptmx.h"
00032 #include <math.h>
00033 
00034 using namespace std;
00035 
00036 #ifdef _WIN32
00037 #define NAN numeric_limits<float>::quiet_NaN();
00038 static inline int isnan(double x){ return _isnan(x); }
00039 #endif
00040 
00041 
00042 
00043 
00045 struct clargs {
00046   Path command;               
00047   Path in_name;               
00048   Path out_name;              
00049   float mincon;                                 
00050   float maxcon;                                 
00051   bool beverbose;                               
00052   bool mMm;                                             
00053 
00054   clargs(int argc, char *argv[]);
00055 };
00056 
00057 
00058 clargs::
00059 clargs(int argc, char *argv[]) :
00060   mincon(NAN),
00061   maxcon(NAN),
00062   beverbose(false),
00063   mMm(false),
00064   out_name("int-<input>")
00065 {
00066 
00067   poptmx::OptionTable table
00068         ("Converts float-point image to the integer one.",
00069          "Can also output minimum and maximum values of the image.");
00070 
00071   table
00072         .add(poptmx::NOTE, "ARGUMENTS:")
00073         .add(poptmx::ARGUMENT, &in_name, "input", "Input image.", "")
00074         .add(poptmx::ARGUMENT, &out_name, "output", "Output image.",
00075                  "", out_name)
00076 
00077         .add(poptmx::NOTE, "OPTIONS:")
00078         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &mincon, 'm', "min",
00079                  "Pixel value corresponding to black.",
00080                  " All values below this will turn black.", "<minimum>")
00081         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &maxcon, 'M', "max",
00082                  "Pixel value corresponding to white.",
00083                  " All values above this will turn white.", "<maximum>")
00084         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &mMm,     0, "minmax",
00085                  "Outputs minimum and maximum of the image.",
00086                  "If this option is given no float-to-int conversion is done"
00087                  " and no output image is written.")
00088         .add_standard_options(&beverbose)
00089         .add(poptmx::MAN, "SEE ALSO:", SeeAlsoList);
00090 
00091   if ( ! table.parse(argc,argv) )
00092         exit(0);
00093   if ( ! table.count() ) {
00094         table.usage();
00095         exit(0);
00096   }
00097 
00098 
00099   command = table.name();
00100   
00101   // <input> : one required argument.
00102   if ( ! table.count(&in_name) )
00103         exit_on_error(command, string () +
00104                                   "Missing required argument: "+table.desc(&in_name)+".");
00105   // <output> : one more argument may or may not exist
00106   if ( ! table.count(&out_name) )
00107     out_name = upgrade(in_name, "int-");
00108 
00109 }
00110 
00111 
00112 
00113 
00115 int main(int argc, char *argv[]) {
00116 
00117   const clargs args(argc, argv) ;
00118 
00119   Map arr;
00120   ReadImage( args.in_name, arr );
00121 
00122   if (args.mMm) {
00123         cout << min(arr) << " " << max(arr) << endl;
00124         exit(0);
00125   }
00126 
00127   float mincon = args.mincon, maxcon = args.maxcon;
00128 
00129   if ( isnan(mincon) ) mincon = min(arr);
00130   if ( isnan(maxcon) ) maxcon = max(arr);
00131 
00132   SaveImage(args.out_name, arr, mincon, maxcon);
00133 
00134   exit(0);
00135 
00136 }
